column2: Shapes and Space -Goal Get comfortable with the coordinate system and drawing static images.
The Canvas. Understand setup() vs draw(). Learn createCanvas() and background().
2D Shapes. Draw rect()  ellipse()  line()  and triangle().
Color & Style. Explore fill() stroke()  strokeWeight()  and RGB/Hex values.
The Coordinate System. Practice placing shapes relative to each other (the origin is the top-left corner!).
Custom Shapes  Use beginShape()  vertex()  and endShape().
Mini-Project: Create a Self-Portrait or a Robot using only basic shapes and colors.
Variables and Animation - Goal: Make things move and react to you.
Variables. Use let to create variables for position (x
Built-in Variables. Experiment with mouseX and mouseY.
Basic Animation. Increment a variable (e.g.  x = x + 1) inside draw() to move a shape.
The random() function. Create jittery movement or random color palettes.
The map() function. Learn to re-map values (e.g. use mouse position to control a color range).
Conditionals (if/else). Make a ball bounce when it hits the edge of the screen.
Mini-Project: Create an interactive drawing tool (a Paint program) where clicking changes colors.
Efficiency and Logic - Goal: Stop repeating yourself and start organizing.
Loops (for loops). Draw 100 circles with 3 lines of code.
Nested Loops. Create a grid or a patterned wallpaper.
Functions. Learn to wrap your drawing code into a custom function like drawTree(x
Transformations. Master translate()
Trigonometry. Use sin() and cos() for smooth  wave-like movement.
Arrays. Store multiple values to keep track of many objects at once.
Mini-Project: A generative pattern generator. Press a key to  re-roll  a random beautiful grid.
Objects and Complexity-Goal: Think like a programmer.
Object-Oriented Programming (Classes). Build a  template  for an object.
Multiple Objects. Use an array to manage 50 Bubble or Particle objects.
Collision Detection. Make objects react when they touch each other.
Media. Learn loadImage() and image() to bring outside graphics into your sketch.
Sound. Introduction to the p5.sound library (making noises on click).
Final Project: Build something complete. Ideas > A simple game (Snake or Pong) - An interactive Music Visualizer. -A  Generative Art Garden  that grows as you move the mouse.
